services

Class ServiceController

  • java.lang.Object
    • services.ServiceController

  • public class ServiceController
extends java.lang.Object
    This ServiceController class, provides an interface for the user to interact with The services stored on disk.
    Author:
    roryoconnor

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ServiceController()
      This constructor will create a new service controller object.

      • getTotalFeesByProvider

        method to find total fees.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        returns the amount owed

      • addServiceRecord

        public boolean addServiceRecord(ServiceRecord record)
        This method will add the ServiceRecord record to the serviceList, and should return true if added successfully and false when not added successfully.
        Parameters:
        record - the ServiceRecord object to be passed in
        Returns:
        returns true if added correctly, false if not

      • getRecordsByMember

        public java.lang.String getRecordsByMember(java.lang.String memberNumber)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method will iterate through the serviceList and will get each record assosciated with the given memberNumber parameter. It will add the record to a string and return all the records assosciated with the member.
        Parameters:
        memberNumber - a string storing the member number we are looking for
        Returns:
        returns a string containing all the records of the member
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if it does not any records for the member number

      • getRecordsByProvider

        public java.lang.String getRecordsByProvider(java.lang.String provNum)
                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        . This method will iterate through the serviceList and will find each service associated with a provider number and add that service to the a string, at the end it will return the string. if a record is not found it will throw an illegal argument exception.
        Parameters:
        provNum - an int storing the provider number this method is searching for
        Returns:
        returns a string of all the records found if any are found. If no records are found, throws an exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if no records matching the provider are found

      • writeRecordToDisk

        public void writeRecordToDisk(ServiceRecord record)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method will create a file for a service record and write the information to the file. The file will be named in the following pattern: memberNumber_dateOfService.txt.
        Parameters:
        record - the ServiceRecord object we would like to write to disk
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the fileName for the service already exists

      • exists

        public boolean exists(java.lang.String memberNumber)
        This method iterates through the service list until it finds a service matching the memberNumber parameter, at which point it will return true. If it cannot find a service matching the member number, this method will return false.
        Parameters:
        memberNumber - a string storing the member number this method is looking for
        Returns:
        returns true if a service matching the member number is found, else it returns false
